data.title: Joan Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: Originated from the Old English language, Joan has been used since the ancient ages around numerous cultures. Read this post to discover its variants.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Joan

Joan is the feminine version of the name John in the English-speaking world. On the other hand, in the Catalan-Valencian and Occitan languages, John is the masculine given name. In all instances, the name is descended from the Greek and Latin phrases Ioannes and Ioanna, making it cognate with John and connected to all of its many forms. John is a typical male given name in the English language that has its roots in Hebrew.

The Greek name Ioannes and its feminine variant Ioanna were the sources of the name, which spread worldwide into many languages and civilizations. It derives from the Hebrew word Yohanan, which means “Yahweh is Gracious,” just like John. Rarely the name Josephine, which is likely to be of Hebrew origin, is shortened to Joan. The Old French feminine variations of the male names Johannes, Johanne, and Jehanne brought the Anglosphere female name Joan into the English language.

Joana is its feminine equivalent in these languages. Historical variants of John in medieval Portuguese included Joan and Joam. While Joana, like in Catalan and Occitan, continues to be the feminine form for Portuguese speakers, the Lusophone world later diverged and adopted Joao as its native form of the masculine John.

The most common spellings of this name are Jaana, Jana, Jane, Janet, Jan, Jean, Jeanne, Johanna and Johanne, Joanne, Juana, Juanita, Joana, Ivana, Jovana, and Jovanka. In the year 1932, a total of 21,045 infants were born under this name, which was the greatest reported usage from 1880 to 2018. The name “Joan” appeared 486,365 times in the SSA public database between 1880 and 2018. Twelve newborns were given the name for the first time in 1880.

A fictitious character on the AMC television program Mad Men is named Joan P. Holloway Harris. She is played by Christina Hendricks, who earned nominations for Primetime Emmy Awards for her work. Joan Watson is a character from the TV show Elementary.

How To Pronounce Joan?

‘Joan’ In QR Code

Notable People Named Joan

This section covers people who have made the name Joan famous with their contributions in various fields. It indeed is a little more inspiration for you to choose the name for your baby, don’t you think?

Joan of ArcPeasant girl, soldier and saint

Joan CrawfordActress

Joan BaezSinger, songwriter, musician, and activist

Joan CollinsActress, author, and columnist

Joan RiversComedian, actress, writer, producer, and television host

Joan AllenAmerican actress, best known for winning the 1984 Drama Desk Award for Outstanding Actress in a Play for her debut in 'Burn This.'

Dame Joan Henrietta CollinsEnglish actress, widely popular for her prominent roles, for which she won Golden Globe Award, People's Choice Award, Soap Opera Digest Award, and a Primetime Emmy Award nomination.

Joan Mary Waller GreenwoodEnglish actress, popular for her work in films like The Man in the White Suit, Young Wives' Tale, and The Importance of Being Earnest

Dame Joan PlowrightEnglish former actress, who won the Golden Globe Awards and a Tony Award and two BAFTA Awards.

Joan Geraldine BennettAmerican actress, well-known for her vamp role in movies like Man Hunt, The Woman in the Window, and Scarlet Street.

Joan Name’s Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby’s name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it’s presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it’s popularity. A name’s online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Here is how Joan fares on that count.

Joan’s Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person’s exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person’s birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth’s orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun’s position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun’s position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby’s zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby’s date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Joan’s Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Joan Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person’s character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person’s attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual’s personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Joan is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Joan‘s Personality As Per Numerology
